Group hierarchy: * AWS Pricing Calculator provides only an estimate of your AWS fees and doesn't include any taxes that might apply. Your actual fees depend on a variety of factors, including your actual usage of AWS services.

Region: the estimated cost of the CloudFront distribution was calculated with https://calculator.s3.amazonaws.com/index.html
Description: since it does not appear in the other calculator.

Group hierarchy: The CloudFront monthly estimate is: 819.74 USD
The final total ends up in: 6159.63 USD
The most important changes made to manage the budget reduction were:
1. Remove the read only replica of the Db. This replica improves data performance reducing network costs and improving workload on the master db
Region: but it is expensive to mantain.

Group hierarchy: Maybe downtime will be longer in case of a disaster
Region: since we can't promote the read replica to master
Description: but the savings are near 1000 USD per month.

Group hierarchy: 2. Move some of the storage of standard S3 to One Zone Infrequent Access. With this change some of the old files from the social network will be moved to other tier
3. The EC2 amount of instances during peaks were reduced from 8 to 5. This is a potential saving.
4. The EC2 instances were changed from t3.large to t3.medium
Region: and were put in a upfront plan for one year.

Group hierarchy: With this the monthly costs of EC2 for Web servers and Applications servers were both reduced from 538 USD to 312 USD.
Incurring only in a upfront fee of 425.74 USD.
